Reviews.Title: “Good budget option”
Reviews.Author: 758aroundmyworld
Reviews.Content: If you don't put too much emphasis on the breakfast, this is a perfect option for you. This cheap hotel (we paid 50 euros per night by credit card) offers wifi, sat TV, modern bathrooms with power showers, firm beds and quite a lot of space. There are plenty of restaurants, bars and clubs around. Just on the other side of the street, there are 2 good restaurants (one more frequented by locals and one more by tourists). I definitely preferd staying in Beyoglu than in Sultanahmet, since restaurants are really better, cheaper and more frequented by locals in this part of the city. The breakfast is served in the underground and is not inspiring. However you can fill with bread, processed cheese, olives and so on. In case you want to skip it, "Simit saray" (a bakery chain) is located very close and you can buy a simit for few coins.

Reviews.Title: “Great location + good service”
Reviews.Author: ArtfulDodgerRus
Reviews.Content: A very well situated hotel - it is on sude-street right next to the Tunnel that we took everyday to get to the historic district - Sultan Ahmet. The nearby street - Istiklal is filled with all possible restraunts, cafes and shops. Devman hotel provided us with great service, the room was very comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay there!!”
Reviews.Author: AnnieRussia
Reviews.Content: We used to go to Devman some times, every time we had something stolen- either a t-shirt (then we saw it on a housekeeper woman) or cosmetics. Last time they took price of room for 1 night twice and told us forget about your money though we have an invoice from them. They shouted etc. The rooms are very poor and the furniture is old. Though hotel bathrooms have been renovated. Breakfast-consider there is no breakfast )) Some cucumbers, olives, egg and tea.. Please don't save money and respect yourself so find some more friendly and cosy hotel to stay

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experience at Devman hotel in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Juliemuli
Reviews.Content: After 4 nights we had to moove to an other hotel, since they asked us much more then the price written. Anyway it was very noisy and the breakfast was so bad that we prefered to take it outside...Ah and yes, the wifi was not working...

Reviews.Title: “Simple B&B but brilliant location.”
Reviews.Author: KLaura01
Reviews.Content: We paid 45 euros for the room per night based on 2 sharing. A basic B&B, standard Turkish breakfast with coffee/tea every morning. A hairdryer and TV in the room with plenty of cupboard space and the rooms are cleaned every day, the rooms also had AC and there was a lobby downstairs. We only stayed 3 nights in Taksim, had to stop off in Istanbul via Dalaman so thought we'd make a short break of it while there. The location of this B&B is PERFECT. And seeing what the other B&B's in that location looked like we were really happy this is the one we chose. In a busy location so quite noisey at night but this didnt put us off at all. If your visiting Istanbul for the sights, shopping and things alike then this B&B is perfect for a short, cheap stay and i would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Shimbles
Reviews.Content: A nice little hotel in a great spot near the bars of Beyoglu. Helpful reception staff who dealt firmly with our money-grabbing (and navigationally-challenged) taxi driver. Room was clean and tidy, albeit fairly basic (good value for the price). Only problem was the early-morning building work in the street outside, which disturbed us in the morning, but probably a commonplace hazard in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: atfos
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only one night since we were visiting from Thessaloniki Greece for the weekend. Some friends recommended the hotel for its price, cleanliness and location. They were absolutely right. Great location, close to Istiklal Cad. Clean rooms, rather spacious (at least room no 302), tastefully equipped and decorated, and everything pretty much working. The breakfast was elementary but fulfilling. All at the very good price of 40 euros per night. But be careful: We asked to keep the room for an extra 6 hours, we were only allowed to keep it for 4 hours, and payed an extra 25 euros! Their poor English can be very tricky!
